content:
First, we need to find the relative speed of the faster train with respect to the slower train:

Relative speed = 50 km/hr - 32 km/hr = 18 km/hr

We need to convert this to meters per second to match the units of the length of the bogie and the time taken to cross it:

Relative speed = 18 km/hr = (18 x 1000) / (60 x 60) m/s = 5 m/s

Now, we can use the formula:

Distance = Speed x Time

Let the length of the slower train be L meters. The time taken for the faster train to cross the last bogie of the slower train is given as 18 seconds.

So, we get:

L + 18 = 5 x 18

L + 18 = 90

L = 90 - 18 = 72 meters

Therefore, the length of the slower train is 72 meters.
